doc.field: Megan O'Shea and Molly A. Cross
Megan O'Shea and Molly A. Cross
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Health Serials
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Health Serials

The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Health Serials contains over 50 titles on physical and mental health issues, medical professionals, and social and political issues related to health in the United States and other countries. The collection dates between 1936 and 2004, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1980s through the 1990s.

The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Health Serials contains over 50 titles on physical and mental health issues, medical professionals, and social and political issues related to health in the United States and other countries. The collection dates between 1936 and 2004, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1980s through the 1990s.

The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Health Serials contains over 50 titles on physical and mental health issues, medical professionals, and social and political issues related to health in the United States (US), Canada, Germany, Sweden, and the United Kingdom. The collection dates between 1936 and 2004, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1980s through the 1990s. Topics include hunger and food assistance programs in the US, end of life care, national health insurance, and HIV and AIDS. The collection also includes serials published by associations of nurses, doctors, therapists, and other professionals.

This collection combines serials relating to health drawn from two discrete groups of material held by the Tamiment Library. The first was a partially inventoried backlog of serials, received by the library through donations, subscriptions, and in archival collections. The second group consisted of around 1,700 serials, newspapers, and magazines, organized by title as an artificial collection, referred to as Periodicals.001 or Boxed Newspapers. This material was combined, inventoried, and arranged and described in subject-based categories in 2017. The accession number related to this collection is 2017.049.
